0.Summary: "McDonald's is a great place to work upper management"
0.Cons: Employees were occasionally disrespectful to staff

1.Summary: "Great for building leadership skills and your resume, but not much else."
1.Pros: + hire from within mentality when it comes to promoting+ great way for young people to get team and leadership skills+decent benefits, McDonalds will treat you well if you stay for a LONG time ( these people are callled "lifers")
1.Cons: -as a manager you're typically working with teenagers and sometimes adults who do not want to work there. It is tough to remain positive- if your management is bad, you will struggle more in all aspects of the job- to get ahead you must devote time, typically much more than 40 hrs a week to your job

2.Cons: Nothing is wrong with this company

3.Pros: free food sometimes and also flexible hours

4.Summary: "Good Entry Job but Opportunities & Incentives Limited"
4.Pros: -Free Meal-Decent Hours-Tuition Aid (havent tried)-Good entry job
4.Cons: -No Overtime-No Overnight Pay Raise-No Break if Short Staffed (going on break on overnights with only 2 coworkers is unrealistic)-Little to no incentive to work hard unless you plan on becoming a manager

5.Pros: Great flipping tools to use. Comfortable handles and contours
5.Cons: Standing all day in a greasy environment. Need to shower a lot.

6.Summary: "Good first job, but don't expect to get paid much, even as a good worker"
6.Pros: Flexible with your availability, get as many hours as you want, no other pros but need to reach word limit
6.Cons: Understaffed, stressful, frequently disrespected by customers and other employees, low pay, very hot working in a kitchen, expected to do your best even without getting paid a decent wage

7.Pros: flexible hours. sometimes it was not that busy. co-workers were pleasant. Sometimes there were food benefits. Overall it was a good experience when I was poor and needed money.
7.Cons: Typically it was very busy, Fast paced environment. I was constantly cleaning. Occasionally I had to work late on weekends which interfered with my social life.

8.Cons: People dont listen to you when you ask a question

9.Pros: Very Friendly environment. Staff was helpful is I were to need assistance. Flexible hours. Competitive pay. Would recommend to anyone.
9.Cons: No real cons. I enjoyed my experience.
